alert.note: Alert for Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 04 at 8:45PM EDT until August 04 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Ulster County in east central New York... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 845 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Kerhonkson, or 11 miles northwest of New Paltz, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... New Paltz, Plattekill, Modena, High Falls, Kerhonkson, Tillson, Lloyd, Esopus, Rosendale, Gardiner, Cherrytown, Maple Hill, Forest Glen, Atwood, Liebhardt, Fantinekill, Stone Ridge, Elting Corners, Ireland Corners and Mombaccus. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
